TrAFFIC REPORT 39

estimated traffic, gross revenues and toll schedules for the crossings included
in the State of Maryland’s Primary Bridge Program. The estimates in this
report show that the same traffic and the same revenue may be expected to
be derived from the Susquehanna River Crossing whether the bridge is con-

sidered as an independent unit on the assumption that none of the other
crossings are constructed, or whether it is combined with the Patapsco and

Potomac River Crossings as a part of the general program. The gross
revenues have been estimated on the basis of a toll rate of twenty cents per
passenger car with bus, truck and special commutation rates as set forth in
detail in the report and as herein listed for convenient reference. (Table 3.)

The estimates of vehicles and gross revenue for the first five years of oper-
ation and the average of the first five years are tabulated in Table 4.

TABLE 4
Susquehanna River
Either Independent Unit or Combined with Patapsco and Potomac Crossings

Average of five years......... .................... 2,474,000 $448,000.00







Because of the competitive situation which would exist if this proposed
bridge across the Susquehanna River were to be considered in conjunction
with the bridge Program including the crossing of the Chesapeake Bay,
the engineers have estimated different volume of traffic and different gross
revenue to be derived from this bridge if it becomes combined with a crossing
of the Bay at Millers Island, or if it becomes combined with a crossing of the
Bay at Sandy Point. If it is considered to be combined with a crossing of
the Bay at Millers Island, the estimated number of vehicles and gross rev-
enue for the first five years and for the average of the first five years are
tabulated in Table 5.

If the proposed bridge across the Susquehanna River were to be combined
with the Chesapeake Bay Bridge at Sandy Point, the estimated number
